course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Laboratory for General Biology II
course.description: This is a practical course accompanied by the lecture course LIFS 1902. It provides students with some basic concepts and hands-on experience in biological investigation within the areas covered by LIFS 1902, including plant biology, human biology and ecology. The emphasis is on the understanding and application of the  scientific principles underlying the experiments. Graded P or F. For students in their first and second year of study; or third and fourth year students with instructor's approval.
course.prerequisites: LIFS 1901 OR level 3 or above in HKDSE 1x Biology OR a passing grade in AL/AS Biology

reviews.author: Kabul
reviews.title: Awful final exam
reviews.comment_content:
Demanding enough.
Especially when you're required to recognize the rat's internal organs, etc. Bobby added a lot of details regarding the experiment, like the machinery and chemical reactions of our digestive system, the chi-square test for test cross of fruit flies (Yes there is statistics!!!), the synthesis of cypermethrin and its ecological impact, etc.

Topics included:
1ï¸âƒ£ Dissection of Rat
      ğŸ”¶ Digestive System
      ğŸ”¶ Excretory / Reproductive System
      ğŸ”¶ Thoracic Cavity
2ï¸âƒ£ Digestion of Protein, Carbohydrate, and Fat
      ğŸ”¶ Benedict's Test for Reducing Sugars
      ğŸ”¶ Iodine Test for Starch
      ğŸ”¶ Secretion of HCl and Pepsin by Gastric Gland
      ğŸ”¶ Phenol Red for Fatty Acids
3ï¸âƒ£ Forensic Study by DNA Fingerprinting
      ğŸ”¶ Human Genome
            Exons, introns, microsatellite region, etc
      ğŸ”¶ Restriction Endonuclease
            Tris-Acetate-EDTA
      ğŸ”¶ Agarose Gel Electrophoresis
            Restriction Fragment Length Polymorphism
      ğŸ”¶ Southern Blotting
            DNA probe, nucleic acid-binding membrane
      ğŸ”¶ Gel-documentation System
            Midori-green
4ï¸âƒ£ Genetic Study by Fruit Fly
      ğŸ”¶ Mendel's Rules
      ğŸ”¶ Life Cycle of Fruit Fly (Drosophila melanogaster)
      ğŸ”¶ Punnett Square
      ğŸ”¶ Chi-square Test
5ï¸âƒ£ Environmental Pollution Risk Assessment
      ğŸ”¶ Acid Rain
      ğŸ”¶ Cypermethrin
      ğŸ”¶ Generation of Nerve Impulse
      ğŸ”¶ Bioassay
      ğŸ”¶ Brine Shrimp (Artemia salina)
      ğŸ”¶ Lethal Dosage

Exams suck. You know what's happened when you hear people's freaks of "fuck!!!" and "å±Œä½ è€å‘³" and their freaks echo endlessly in the lecture theater after the exam. Lots of things to remember and every tiny bit of information (including the Latin scientific names of fruit flies - "Drosophila melanogaster", and brine shrimps - "Artemia salina", how there are cultured in the medium, their growth and metamorphosis, how a nerve impulse is generated and propagated and all those sodium and potassium channel thingy, and also the calculation chi-square I've just mentioned) will be asked in the final exams.

There are no so-called "main points" in his PowerPoint - EVERY little word, schematic diagram, and picture will be asked in the exam. If you believe there are "main points" and you don't really pay attention to the other tiny bits of miscellaneous information, you're finished!!!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Bobby has a funny Hong Kong Chinglish accent. But NOT bad - at least he can explain everything clearly, given that you can understand his accent.

** Bobby has recently been diagnosed with late-stage colon cancer. Please show your support to Bobby and hope he can recover soon.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading has been changed from previously P/F into A+ to F this semester. For those who still naively think it's a P/F course and don't really work hard for the final exam, good luck!!! Btw I needa thank those people so much coz I'm gonna have a chance to strive for a better grade. Yay~ But it's awful enough to have an A+ to F grading for a 1-credit course - it does nothing but gives a lot of stress and tension. Okay, I understand that... It's University of Stress and Tension anyway, accept it or not. Phew ~ T.T

Another thing is that once you miss one lab session without any reason, you'll immediately be failed, unlike in previous years one lab session can be missed without any penalty. It's become much harsher than before.

Final Exam:
Mean: 43.3/91
SD: 12.7

But my final grade was not as bad as I thought. Some students obviously did not treat this exam seriously... I got 60/91 (1.3 SD above mean) in final.

ğŸ’¯ Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
It's a workload of a 3-credit course with 1 credit in disguise. Need to study at least 1 week before the exam to memorize all the important and unimportant messy details related or unrelated to the experiments.

Full of regrets. I should've started revision much earlier, and I would've remembered "Drosophila melanogaster" and "Artemia salina". Could have done better in the final... Tears

reviews.comment_teaching: jesscia is nice. her teaching is fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
Experimental Worksheets â€“20% (Total of 4) (almost full marks)
Laboratory Performance â€“16%  (full marks)
Written Final Examination â€“64% (unknown)
overall B+

Students who fail to meet following conditions may be considered for â€œFâ€
i.FULL attendance on all laboratory sessions
ii.Submission of ALL required worksheets
reviews.comment_workload: very light workload. you only have to attend 4 labs and hand in 4 lab reports. 2 are in-class assignments, 2 are take-home assignments.  you only have to work hard on your final exam in order to get a good grade. overall, the exam was easy. it was mainly mc and quite straightforward.

reviews.author: Wong One Big
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the content are related to DSE syllabus, only a small part is new and not taught in LIFS 1902.
Lab 1 Rat dissection (90% DSE staff)
Lab 2 Forensic Study by DNA Finger Printing (60% DSE staff)
Lab 3 Digestion of Carbohydrates, Proteins and Fats (50% DSE staff)
Lab 4 Genetics Study using Fruit Fly (80% DSE staff)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Actually, I originally give C to teaching as I can hardly hear what Jessica is saying even I am sitting at the middle of the bench.
Also, I would even her speech is not that well developed. ä½¢è¬›å’—å˜¢å¥½ä¼¼ç­‰æ–¼å†‡è¬›éå’...... Sometimes, it is difficult to get what she is saying. But luckily, what she said can be found on lab manual or you can ask TAs for help. TAs are really really nice!!!But be careful that some changes in the conc of chemicals will only be announced during briefing.

There is some video recording and displaying on what is occurring on the briefing stage. This is one of the good point about this course. But again, the filming skills is ...... hard to explain...... Also, one of the accents of the technician who is sometimes responsible for demonstration is quite heavy and it is hard to catch what he is saying.

Reason why I finally give B is that professor and all the technicians and TAs are really helpful!!! Feel free to ask them questions (if necessary). The TAs responsible for my bench is Jessica and Clooney who are really helpful and nice!!!! Not only will answer you questions patiently in class and on email, but they also mark the lab reports very seriously with highlighting where you score points.
reviews.comment_grading:
For lab report 1:
I got 8.6/8.6: Mean is 8.1

For lab report 2:
I got 8.25/10; Mean is 8

For lab report 3:
I got 9.75/10; Mean is 8.9

For lab report 4:
I got 10.3/10.3; Mean is 9.4

For all lab performance,
I got 4/4 for all; Mean is around 3.9.4
Actually, if you attend lab on time, it is very easy to get full marks.
Rmb to bring lab coats!! And bundle your long hairs!! Otherwise, marks will be deducted.

The score for final exam is not revealed. But I think the exam is quite easy as most of the questions appeared can be found on lab manual.

Finally, I get A+ (I get A- in LIFS1902). As the professor teaching this course has been changed to Jessica, I am not sure whether the grade of this course is leng or lan as compared to the previous professor.
reviews.comment_workload:
I would say that workload of this course (1 cred) is lighter that 1/3 of LIFS 1902 (3 cred).
I think it would be fine for having no pre-lab as most of the things are just common sense, like dissecting a mouse and counting the number of male/female/wing/wingless flies (although guidelines and steps on the lab manual is not that clear as compared to that of Gen Chem Labs).

The workloads of this course:
1. Lab reports (Esp lab reports 2&3 which are take-home assignment. Everytime I handed in the lab report, I was afraid that I missed any important points and kept adding staff onto the reports)
2. Final exams (I only study lab manual and ppt one afternoon and night before start of the exam)
I rmb that in the exam, no scientific name of flies is asked. But in MCs, conc of TAE (knowing how to find it is ok when going through ppt) and name of TAE was asked. I remember only 1 questions in lab procedures was asked.

reviews.author: Hahaha
reviews.title: annoying lab
reviews.comment_content:
There are 5 labs per semester.
They say there is textbook, but I didnt buy it for they provide lab manual and that was enough.

Lab 1 Rat Dissection  
Lab 2 Digestion of carbohydrate, protein and fat
Lab 3 Forensic study by DNA Fingerprinting
Lab 4 Genetic study by Fruit Fly
Lab 5 Environmental pollution and pollutant risk assessment

Each lab tries to apply the concepts you learnt in LIFS 1902 in topics like human biology, biochemistry, ecology and human biology.
They are very easy if you know the theories in the lecture LIFS 1902.

I think I have to explain it here for it is part of lab safety. I recommend you to take your own mask to Lab 1-Rat dissection lab. The rat smells very badly and they do not provide masks.
reviews.comment_teaching: you only have to read Presentation slides. They explain the presentation slides and cautions before the lab starts. Lab presentation covers most part of the LIFS1902 chapters. It is quiet boring.
reviews.comment_grading: It is pass or fail. Most of students get passes unless you miss the labs. you attend all the labs and just make sure that you go for final exam.  They all are multiple choice questions. For my case, I got a pass.There is no midterm, which is the best part of this course. :)
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is moderate. you have to team up with 3 more people and work with them together. They allow you to choose your labmate and have to confirm them on canvas. If you dont have labmate to work with, dont worry! The instructors will form a group for you!

Also, you have to pay attention to lab results since you have to submit the lab result right after the lab ends.

You go to lab twice a week. I prefer you reading the material before the lab is very helpful( It is still okay even if you do not read. But, to be confident, just read them and go. otherwise, you will feel lost).
I personally think it should be at least 2 credits because just 1 credit is too less for this much of workload.

reviews.author: Hei222
reviews.comment_content:
1ï¼‰Rat Dissection  2ï¼‰Digestion of carbohydrate, protein and fat
3ï¼‰Forensic study by DNA Fingerprinting 4ï¼‰Genetic study by Fruit Fly 5ï¼‰Environmental pollution and pollutant risk assessment
reviews.comment_teaching: It's really boring I should say. The instructor is just simply reading out the ppt (I guess no one would pay attention to the pre-lab session). Exact amount of samples and solutions for one practice are provided. So be careful as they probably wont offer you more due to any reasons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not Bad. I ended up with A-
5 lab reports, mainly got 8-9 out of 10.
Final I got 66 out of 91, the mean is 45.9, so quite easy to get A arrange.
the exam is a bit tricky btw, but huge tips can be found in the other comments (probably the reason why I done better in the final)
reviews.comment_workload: not heavy at all

reviews.author: wtk
reviews.comment_content:
5 lab exercise
1. Rat Dissection
2. Digestion of carbohydrate, protein and fat
3. Forensic study by DNA Fingerprinting
4. Genetic study by Fruit Fly
5. Environmental pollution and pollutant risk assessment
The content is related to LIFS 1902.
reviews.comment_teaching: Before the lab experiment, he does pre-lab talk which is the theory of the experiment. Also, he has demonstration for the student to watch.
reviews.comment_grading:
A+ to F
       25% Experimental worksheet (5 laboratory ws) (10 mark is the highest)
       10% Laboratory Performance
       65% Final Examination (MC & fill-in-the blanks)
reviews.comment_workload:
5 lab ws
         3 in-class assignment (do it quickly)
         2 take-home assignment(have 2 weeks to finish the assignment)

reviews.author: evvv
reviews.title: dumbest final I've ever sat for lol
reviews.comment_content:
5 lab exercise:
1) rat dissection (I recommended bringing a face mask since they don't provide one)
2) digestion of Carbohydrate, Protein and Fat (some of the chemicals didn't work - I think the LIFS department is really underfunded lol)
3) Forensic Study by DNA Finger Printing
4) Genetics Study by Fruit Fly
5) Environmental Pollution and Pollutant Risk Assessment (most annoying one)

Content is not very interesting or new - if you have any bio background you've probably done most of the experiments in secondary school and know what they're talking about during class.

The final was pretty screwed up. It was MC questions and fill-in-the-blanks questions. The grammar was kinda bad so I was very confused, especially in the fill-in-the-blanks part. It was super unpredictable. They ask weird questions like the scientific name of the animal you experimented on and the amount of substance you used during experiments. How is that even applicable in a lab situation this is just useless information I have to memorise wtf.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is not good but its not bad either. Its what you expect from science school standards i guess. The TAs are more helpful if you don't understand anything.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is kinda weird since only 30% counts to your experiments and 70% is your final exam. Its more like a final exam course than a lab course.

Study the powerpoints thoroughly and remember the scientific names of the animals. I think its kinda dumb that they ask that though.

I cannot stress how important you have to study the ppt. Study every detail because you have no idea what they're going to ask since they ask the useless info as well. Truly the most disastrous final Ive ever sat for. Im still mad.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light. Only 5 lab experiments once every few weeks. Some of it has take home assignments so just remember to do it.

It is a lab course so you have to come for all experiments or you might not pass.

reviews.author: SA_1007
reviews.title: Exam is unpredictable! for the good and for the bad
reviews.comment_content:
5 lab practicals conducted in a bi-weekly basis
- PowerPoint slides for pre-lab presentation will be uploaded, (so actually reading the ppt slides would actually be a quicker way to prepare for your lab practical, my suggestion actually)
-

1) Rat dissection - in class worksheet
-involves respiratory system, digestive system and the reproductive system
- the worksheet involved labeling of organs
- whole idea of the practical is to get used to dissecting

2) Digestion of food by amylase/pepsin/lipase
-take home assignment

3) DNA fingerprinting
-Take home assignment
-be careful when adding samples to the electrophoresis gel !!

4) Genetics study of fruit flies - in class WS
- counting and sorting fruit flies (this is very tiring)
-figuring out the genotype of them
-this lab you will learn how to use the chi-square
every math-idiots can understand that concept

5) environmental pollution and pollutant risk management [ in class WS ]
-using brine shrimps to test suitable growth in various acidic or basic environment
- one calculation question regarding LD 50 and molarity

< < EXAM !!! > >
- 55MCs
- 36 blanks for fill-in-the blanks

##(highly recommend remembering the scientific names of fruit flies and the brine shrimps)
# only one chi-square question turned up
# do study everything in the label
# even the name of the gel reading machine name came up :(
honestly the fill in the blanks was way harder then the MC
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching assistants are all very helpful and easy-to-approach. Do feel free to ask them anything (but not the answers).
Bobby does pre-lab presentation before beginning the lab session, so actually (speaking from experience) if you have forgotten to do pre-lab preparation, you can actually just listen to his talk and watch his demonstration.
Though some people do have trouble keeping up with his darn strong chinglish accent. Though locals students don't seem to mind
He does really teach everything clearly and everyone seems to keep up with his pace.
So overall his teaching is not too bad, I guess.
reviews.comment_grading:
Each lab assignment are graded with 10 points max, no grading. (my average was 8.5)
full marks of exam was 91.
As I am writing this feedback right after the exam I cant say reveal my final grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
I wouldn't say its high because out of the 5 lab practicals, only 2 of them are take-home assignments. And you will have over a week to complete them. Besides you just have to answer the questions given in the lab manual, Not a full lab report and no citation is required :)

The remaining 3 reports are in-class and you will have enough time to finish them as those experiments are relatively simple and done quickly.

reviews.author: Andy HK
reviews.comment_content: The five experiments are dissection of rat, digestion of carbohydrate, protein and fat, forensic study by DNA fingerprinting, genetic study by fruit fly and environmental pollution and pollutant risk assessment.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is not clear enough.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is suitable. I only get 34/93 in final exam but i get c+ eventually.
reviews.comment_workload: We only had five classes during the semester. In every lesson, we need to submit a report. There are 2 reports which can be taken to home to finish and the other 3 reports need to be submitted at the end of the lesson.

reviews.author: Ada0120
reviews.title: Disastrous Final Exam
reviews.comment_content: The content is related to Lifs1902, only with more things to be recited. For example, students are required to identify every bit of the rat's organ.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The tutor has a funny accent and often speaks Chinglish without he noticing. Although being a HongKonger like him, I seldom need to guess what he just said. Often spends a long time (e.g. 40 mins) to talk about the experiment and the principal before starting it, which is pretty boring. Do pay close attention to it, as those will appear in the final exam.

And don't let him catch you doing anything wrong in the experiment, or you may get your marks deducted. Try to ask the TAs instead if you have any questions.
reviews.comment_grading: I got a pretty bad grade as I didn't know that questions asked in the final would not be solely based on the experiments, but also the principals. Please make sure that you read every bit (not joking) of those powerpoints, or you may risk getting c range in this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
The course is very demanding. First of all. students are required to do a lab report after each lab, in which some of them are take-home assignments. Though students have 2 weeks to complete that, it is hard to get a high marks.

The final is a disaster - it includes questions that you will never expect. For instance, students need to spell the scientific name of sea monkey, which the tutor only mentioned once during lessons. As I said, you need to pay attention in class and recite the ppts, or else you will end up staring at the exam paper and start guessing the answer of the mcs ( like me).

reviews.author: tcchanak
reviews.comment_content: All related to 1902 but with more details

reviews.author: claudialo1802
reviews.title: Pre-lab talk sucks!!
reviews.comment_content:
Exp 1 Rat Dissection
-digestive system
-excretory system
-reproductive system
Exp 2 Digestion of Carbonhydrate,Protein and Fat
-diff. kinds of simple tests
Exp 3 Forensic Study by DNA Fingerprinting
-DNA probe fingerprinting
Exp 4 Genetics Study by Fruit Fly
-Mendel's first and second law
Exp 5 Environmental Pollution and Pollutant Risk Assessment

Generally DSE stuffs. If you study biology before, it is quite easy to catch up the concept.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He has a terrible chinglish accent which is quite hard to understand even you are a local student. He only recaps the ppt without much explanation.
Pre-lab talk is way too long, it takes almost 1-hour for every experiment but the experiment may only take you half an hour to finish. You can see many students take out their computer and do their own stuffs or play with their phone but not listen to him.
However, the comments given by the TAs of the lab report are quite useful if you do not understand the concept.
reviews.comment_grading:
It provides you a lab manual which almost cover all the stuffs from the exam, if you really want to have A range, revise the ppt which will uploaded to the canvas, and the lab report too.
Exam sucks as it asks you really minor but useless thing, like the scientific names of brine shrimp and fruit fly, or the conc. of certain chemical which you have used in the expt., so if you want to get high marks, you need to memorize the whole lab manual with every single word.

Final exam:
Full score = 91, Mean = 43.3, Lowest* = 22, Highest = 78
I got 42/91, B grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Have experiment bi-weekly and in total 5 expt. only.
No quizzes or mid-term exams.
The lab report are quite easy, consists of 2 take home assignments and 3 in-class assignments.
Take home assignments usually require you to explain concepts with complete sentences and elaborate with clear logic (around 2-3 pages)(1-2 paragraphs per question).
In-class assignments are easier than take home one, only fill in the blanks (e.g. identification of organs from pictures for expt.1)

reviews.comment_content: Highly related to 1902 lecture course, the experiments are similar every year, for example,  Rat dissection, DNA gel electrophoresis, Toxicity analysis...
reviews.comment_teaching: Before starting the lab work, the professor read the ppt, which is quite boring. But sometimes, you can go out to the instructor's bench, to see how he demonstrates the lab.

reviews.author: earthworm6
reviews.comment_content: Lab based on the lecture course, so it was basically what we know. However, the questions that we have to answer after the lab were like of complicated to get the answer at the first hand. Actually, I don't really know the purpose of this lab as the content is so limited to the course that some labs are the one that you can easily think and get the content.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor read the ppt as it is written in there, but nothing else. The way he presented was so boring that no one really concentrate on his talk. The TAs were so annoying, they showed very arrogant attitude towards students commanding us. One TA said like "Student, clean it." I was uncertain it was due to the lack of her english ability but I was pretty sure that she could be nicer.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is based on the lab activity, and the final exam. You should be careful not to omit any of this lab course because they check your attendence. They want you to be there at all the time and submit the work. If you miss one lap, you can make a make up lab session, but they usually don't accept it. (As I said, they are not that much kind people)
reviews.comment_workload: Not much thing to prepare before the lab as the work should be done during the lab. However, it is worth reading the questions and think about how to solve it. It is also good to secretly talk to anyone next to you to discuss the answer.

reviews.author: Research+Doc
reviews.title: Good for endless chit-chatting, but it's hard to imagine anything more useless.
reviews.comment_content:
Rat dissection, enzymatic assay, DNA gel electrophoresis, Mendelian genetics, toxicity analysis (LD50). It's said to supplement LIFS1902, but the only part interesting reallyt is the rat dissection. And oh it's 2 people sharing a rat, so it's less fun than you'd have liked of course. The only thing useful about enzymatic assay is that you gotta know how to operate a pipetteman, which honestly a third grader can learn in 2 minutes. DNA gel electrophoresis -- concept is good since it's routinely used in research labs too, but the techniques taught are just wrong (e.g. NEVER EVER add DNA samples above the wells -- add them into the friggin wells). Oh and the resulting UV-exposed photo usually doesn't show good results, sometimes because of poor exposure by the technicians (you'll know after one or two times at research labs). Genetics is kind of boring, and scary for those who fear arthropods. Toxicity analysis is kind of brutal too, just watching those little creatures suffocating and dying in the toxic solutions.
What's worse, you wait and wait and wait and chat and chat and chat until you've got nothing more to chat about and the wall starts to become really interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring. Boring. Boring. It's literally just a reiteration of what's been covered in LIFS1902, with a bit more of experimental techniques perhaps. Bobby's not exactly the funniest instructor, but considering his hilarious pronunciations he fares well in that department. Plus, you've got a huge crowd gathered around the instructor's bench, which makes it extremely difficult to hear him clearly, let alone seeing what he does / demonstrates, if you're sitting at the back.
reviews.comment_grading: Pass or fail. Final is pretty damn hard actually, e.g. asking you what buffer (and the concentration too) you'd use in DNA gel. But, again, since it's just pass or fail, take it easy.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light. Labs either have worksheets to be handed in during class, or reports on the next session. Each session have 2 weeks in between though, and the reports are not quite formal in fact, so it's all very easy to handle, unlike CHEM1050 or CHEM1055.

reviews.author: NaiNai
reviews.title: Easy Job
reviews.comment_content:
- Rat dissection
- Enzymatic assay
- DNA gel electrophoresis
- Mendelian genetics
- Toxicity analysis (LD50)

Easy and simple. Learning very basic skills, which may already be taught in secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Experiment content including theory, procedure and precaution would be gone through by TAs at the beginning of the class.
But it is quite boring and time consuming, as you should do pre-lab before the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or fail.
Grade depends on worksheet and final exam.
Worksheets are easy as most of the answer can be found in the lab manual. Final exam is fairly difficult.
You are god if you can fail this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload compared to other 1 credit lab course.
Pre-lab -> worksheet -> final
